4. Supports the High Representative's role in monitoring implementation and coordinating civilian organizations.

5. Expresses support for declarations of the Peace Implementation Conference.

6. Intends to keep implementation and the situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina under review, considering measures if parties fail to meet their obligations.

7. Recalls support for the EU force and NATO presence, and their role in ensuring compliance with the Peace Agreement.

8. Pays tribute to participating Member States in the multinational stabilization force (EUFOR) and NATO presence.

9. Welcomes the EU's intention to maintain a military operation in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

10. Authorizes a multinational stabilization force (EUFOR) for 12 months, under unified command and control.

11. Authorizes a NATO Headquarters presence to continue assisting in implementing the Peace Agreement.

12. Reaffirms that the Peace Agreement and previous resolutions apply to EUFOR and the NATO presence.

13. Intends to consider further authorization as necessary, based on developments in implementing the Peace Agreement.

14. Authorizes Member States to take necessary measures to ensure compliance with Annexes 1-A and 2 of the Peace Agreement.
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

 Authorizes NATO presence to ensure implementation of certain annexes and protection of EUFOR and NATO presence (para 15).

 Authorizes Member States to take necessary measures to defend EUFOR and NATO presence and assist in their missions (para 15).

 Authorizes Member States to ensure compliance with airspace rules and procedures over Bosnia and Herzegovina (para 16).

 Demands respect for security and freedom of movement of EUFOR, NATO presence, and international personnel (para 17).

 Requests reporting on EUFOR and NATO presence activities at least every three months (para 18).

 Invites States to provide support and facilities for Member States acting under certain paragraphs (para 19).

 Reiterates appreciation for EU Police Mission deployment since 2003 (para 20).

 Requests Secretary-General to submit reports on Peace Agreement implementation (para 21).

 Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 22).
